definition: to be united in action
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
(bound form) fine/delicate

sentences.english: It's like a military march- every one in step.
sentences.chinese: 它就像部队行军，每个人都步调一致。

sentences.english: His work has walked in lockstep with his Catholic faith.
sentences.chinese: 他的工作与他的天主教信仰步调一致。

sentences.english: Yet the six have nonetheless managed to keep in step.
sentences.chinese: 然而最近这六国却试图言行统一，步调一致。

definition: to twist together to form a rope/(fig.) to unite/to work together
of one mind (idiom)
lit. if he orders you go, he forbids you stop (idiom); fig. to demand exact compliance with instructions/to ensure strictly obedience
tacit understanding/mutual understanding/rapport/connected at a deep level with each other/(of team members) well coordinated/tight
gait/marching order/step/pace
to unite/unity/solidarity/united
each one does what he thinks is right (idiom)/each goes his own way
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
to go forward together (idiom); to undertake simultaneous tasks/going hand in hand
unswerving/unflinching
to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)
hand in hand and shoulder to shoulder
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
